definitions.definition: to arrange something in groups according to features that they have in common

examples.text: The books in the library **are classified according to** subject.
These can be classified under five headings.
We can classify machines in terms of their function.
All rural settlements were classified according to their size.
Antiques can be classified according to a number of criteria.
The books are all classified by subject.
Soils can be classified under two main headings.
The study recorded and classified accidents over a period of a year.

definitions.definition: to decide which type or group somebody/something belongs to

examples.text: Only eleven of these accidents were classified as major.
It was classified as a sports car, which meant a $3 000 annual insurance bill.

definitions.definition: to state that information is officially secret

examples.text: All the documents relating to the case have been classified.

wordOrigin: late 18th cent.: back-formation from classification, from French, from classe ‘class’, from Latin classis ‘division’.
